intro: Cleome lilloi, commonly known as the narrowleaf cleome, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Cleome lilloi is typically found in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and prairies.
